title: Nezha Chekrouni
text: Nouzha Chekrouni ( ; born 1955, <a href="Meknes">Meknes</a>) is a Senior Fellow in Advanced Leadership at Harvard University who holds a Doctorate degree in linguistics from Sorbonne Nouvelle in Paris. She was a politician of the <a href="Socialist%20Union%20of%20Popular%20Forces">Socialist Union of Popular Forces</a> party of <a href="Morocco">Morocco</a> and a Delegate-Minister for the Moroccans Living Abroad in the <a href="cabinet%20of%20Morocco">cabinet</a> of <a href="Driss%20Jettou">Driss Jettou</a> (2002–2007), Delegate-Minister for Women Conditions, Family and Children Protection and Secretary of State for the Handicapped in the cabinet of <a href="Abderrahmane%20Youssoufi">Abderrahman el-Yousfi</a> (1998–2002). Since January 2009 she is Ambassador of Morocco to <a href="Canada">Canada</a>. Dr. Chekrouni was professor of linguistics in the Faculty of Arts & Social Sciences at the university of <a href="Meknes">Meknes</a>.
